prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0.0 for the x-axis, 0.0 for the y-axis, and -90.0 for the z-axis. Set the translation vector to 0.0 for the x-axis, 0.5 for the y-axis, and 0.0 for the z-axis. Proceed to create the sketch for this part. Focus on the first face of the sketch, which will be a flat plane with six straight lines. Start with the first line, which goes from 0.0 on the x-axis to 0.75 on the x-axis at the 0.0 y-value. The second line will start at 0.75 on the x-axis and move upward to 0.75 on the x-axis and 0.25 on the y-axis. Continue with the third line, which goes from 0.75 on the x-axis and 0.25 on the y-axis to 0.5 on the x-axis and 0.25 on the y-axis. Draw the fourth line from 0.5 on the x-axis and 0.25 on the y-axis up to 0.25 on the x-axis and 0.625 on the y-axis. The fifth line will travel leftward from 0.25 on the x-axis and 0.625 on the y-axis to 0.0 on the x-axis and 0.625 on the y-axis. To close the loop, draw the sixth line from 0.0 on the x-axis and 0.625 on the y-axis down to 0.0 on the x-axis and back to 0.0 on the y-axis. The sketch should now be complete. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by scaling it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Apply the given Euler angles and translation vector during this transformation process. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by 0.5 units, giving it a total height of 0.75. Consider this the first part of the CAD assembly. The part's dimensions, as determined from the VLM model, are as follows: - Shape: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.5 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>
completion:

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.5,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.25],"End Point":[0.5,0.25]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.25],"End Point":[0.25,0.625]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.625]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1:** *Shape to be constructed: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and parallel sides.* 1. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop (loop_1) with five straight lines (line_1 to line_5) as follows: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.125, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.125, 0.0], End Point [0.125, 0.125] - line_3: Start Point [0.125, 0.125], End Point [0.125, 0.25] - line_4: Start Point [0.125, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - line_5: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Instructions for Part 2:** *Shape to be constructed: A rectangular prism with a curved top edge.* 1. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.125, 0.375, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop (loop_1) with six straight lines (line_1 to line_6) as follows: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.25, 0.125] - line_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.125], End Point [0.25, 0.0] - line_3: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.625, 0.0] - line_4: Start Point [0.625, 0.0], End Point [0.625, 0.25] - line_5: Start Point [0.625, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - line_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.125] **Instructions for Part 3:** *Shape to be constructed: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners.* 1. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.125, 0.375, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop (loop_1) with four straight lines (line_1 to line_4) as follows: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.125] - line_3: Start Point [0.25, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.125] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.0] In all three parts, please scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor provided, and extrude the sketches along the normal vector, following the dimensions mentioned in the JSON. Use the respective operation (NewBodyFeatureOperation, JoinFeatureOperation) for each part, as mentioned in the JSON data. The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top, flat bottom, and slightly tapered sides. For each part, the length is mentioned in the "length" value of the corresponding "description" entry, the width is present in the "width" value, and the height is mentioned in the "height" value. The overall final dimensions of the shape are inferred from the three parts.</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1** **Final Shape:** A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism has a small rectangular opening on the side. **Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.75, 0.0, 0.0 **Step 2: Creating the Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1) with one loop (loop_1). - Loop_1 contains 9 lines (line_1 to line_9) arranged in a rectangular shape with a small rectangular opening on the side. **Line 1:** Start Point: 0.0, 0.0; End Point: 0.25, 0.0 **Line 2:** Start Point: 0.25, 0.0; End Point: 0.375, 0.0 **Line 3:** Start Point: 0.375, 0.0; End Point: 0.375, 0.25 **Line 4:** Start Point: 0.375, 0.25; End Point: 0.25, 0.25 **Line 5:** Start Point: 0.25, 0.25; End Point: 0.25, 0.125 **Line 6:** Start Point: 0.25, 0.125; End Point: 0.125, 0.125 **Line 7:** Start Point: 0.125, 0.125; End Point: 0.125, 0.25 **Line 8:** Start Point: 0.125, 0.25; End Point: 0.0, 0.25 **Line 9:** Start Point: 0.0, 0.25; End Point: 0.0, 0.0 The loop is a closed loop consisting of these lines, creating a rectangular shape with a small rectangular opening on the side. **Step 3: Extruding the Sketch** Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with the following properties: - Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 - Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.75 - Sketch Scale: 0.375 - Operation: New solid body This will create the final shape described in the instructions.</description>
